interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: WWII In HD: Collector’s Edition
Review Date: 2020/07/26
Store: Rob Lowe  (Actor),     Justin Bartha  (Actor),     Frederic Lumiere  (Director),     Matthew Ginsburg  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Documentary
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Seventy years in the making. Three thousand hours of color footage few knew existed. The first documentary to show original color footage of World War II in immersive HD, the world premiere HISTORYTM series WWII IN HD uses the journals and accounts of those who served in the war s biggest battles to create a personal, introspective and detailed look at life on and off the front lines. This lavish gift set includes the original HISTORY series plus two specials: THE AIR WAR and IWO JIMA.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': 'unknown', 'Director': 'Frederic Lumiere, Matthew Ginsburg', 'Media Format': "Box set, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Run time': '7 hours and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 15, 2012', 'Actors': 'Rob Lowe, Justin Bartha', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '5'}

reference_summary:
The Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: Set 2 Ian Carmichael (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Mystery & Suspense ['Ian Carmichael stars in the original British adaptations', '"Eternally appealing" --NPR’s Fresh Air', 'As seen on Masterpiece Theatre', '"Realized superbly" --', 'The New York Times', '"The cast is splendid" --', 'The Washington Post', 'IAN CARMICHAEL STARS in the original BBC adaptations of the Dorothy L. Sayers crime thrillers. Hailed by critics as one of the finest mystery series ever filmed, its success on PBS’s Masterpiece Theatre inspired the spin-off Mystery! Running at least three hours each, these dramas do full justice to Sayers’s vivid characters, trenchant wit, and lavish 1920s settings.', 'THE MYSTERIES:', 'MURDER MUST ADVERTISE Lord Peter goes deep undercover at Pym’s Publicity to investigate the suspicious death of a young copywriter following his affair with a wealthy and indolent socialite.', 'FIVE RED HERRINGS When the body of an unpopular artist is found in a stream, it’s up to Lord Peter to determine which of six suspects could have committed the crime.', 'THE NINE TAILORS Stranded in a sleepy village after a car accident, Lord Peter quickly stumbles upon a decades-old case of stolen emeralds, unidentifiable corpses, and coded messages.'] {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/British Mystery Theater, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Ian Carmichael', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8435', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 4 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 28, 2010', 'Actors': 'Ian Carmichael', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '3'} it arrived early and packaged well. played well and was very enjoyable. Five Stars {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alex Gabassi'], 'Producers': ['Mammoth Screen LTD', 'Agatha Christie Productions LTD', 'Farah Abushwesha'], 'Starring': ['John Malkovich', 'Rupert Grint', 'Andrew Buchan']} I love this adaption! I've never been a fan of the David Suchet "Poirot". his character came across as prissy and more of a caricature than anything else. so to see the Poirot that Malkovich portrayed was such a treat, he brought depth to the character that was sadly lacking before.
I would highly recommend this to anyone even if they're not Agatha Christie fans. profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

- **Genres of Interest:** The user maintains a strong preference for mystery and suspense, especially enjoying British adaptations and innovative reimaginings of classic characters. They have shown an expanding interest in historical documentaries, particularly those with high production values and a focus on authentic storytelling.

- **Format Preference:** They continue to favor boxed sets, reflecting a desire for comprehensive collections across various themes, including both narrative-driven series and documentary formats.

- **Quality Appreciation:** The user remains committed to high-quality production and critically acclaimed content. Their recent positive experience with a documentary indicates a broader appreciation for well-crafted narratives, even outside their typical genre interests.

- **Key Features:** Intricate storytelling, rich character development, and fresh interpretations that enhance original works are crucial to their viewing experience. They value documentaries that provide an introspective look at historical events, informed by personal accounts.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user has expressed satisfaction through positive ratings, demonstrating a keen interest in engaging and accurate storytelling. Their reviewing behavior highlights a consistent appreciation for quality content, whether in fictional adaptations or informative documentaries, reinforcing their evolving taste for diverse genres while maintaining a focus on thoughtful presentation and character-driven plots.
